intro: Eupatorium paramense, commonly known as the Paramense boneset, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clustered, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats and is often found in marshy areas along the Atlantic coast of Brazil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer and early autumn. Eupatorium paramense is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its potential medicinal properties.
